title: Historical Stock Splits and Corporate Actions: Associated Banc-Corp

content.text: 1. July 29, 1992: Associated Banc-Corp executed a 2-for-1 stock split. This means that for every existing share held by shareholders, they received an additional share.
2. January 28, 1998: Associated Banc-Corp executed a 2-for-1 stock split.
3. June 30, 1999: Associated Banc-Corp executed a 2-for-1 stock split.
4. May 1, 2000: Associated Banc-Corp executed a 2-for-1 stock split.
5. May 21, 2001: Associated Banc-Corp executed a 2-for-1 stock split.
6. December 1, 2003: Associated Banc-Corp executed a 2-for-1 stock split.
7. September 17, 2007: Associated Banc-Corp executed a 2-for-1 stock split.
8. April 3, 2019: Associated Banc-Corp executed a 3-for-2 stock split. This means that for every two existing shares held by shareholders, they received an additional share.
9. March 21, 2022: Associated Banc-Corp executed a 4-for-3 stock split. This means that for every three existing shares held by shareholders, they received an additional share.
1. October 22, 1986: Associated Banc-Corp declared a cash dividend of $0.16 per share.
2. October 19, 1994: Associated Banc-Corp declared a cash dividend of $0.35 per share.
3. October 25, 2000: Associated Banc-Corp declared a cash dividend of $0.29 per share.
4. October 19, 2005: Associated Banc-Corp declared a cash dividend of $0.31 per share.
5. October 19, 2011: Associated Banc-Corp declared a cash dividend of $0.20 per share.
1. July 1, 2004: Associated Banc-Corp announced the acquisition of First National Bank & Trust Company, expanding its presence in Wisconsin.
2. June 6, 2016: Associated Banc-Corp completed the acquisition of Bank Mutual Corporation, enhancing its customer base and market share in Wisconsin.
3. January 1, 2020: Associated Banc-Corp completed the acquisition of First Staunton Bancshares, further expanding its presence in Wisconsin and Illinois.
